data.title: JUST ARRIVED: GIBSON 1956 Les Paul GoldTop
data.meta_description: The GIBSON 1956 Les Paul GoldTop VOS has just arrived at our Melbourne CBD store, so we take a deep dive into everything that makes the Goldtop one of the most sought-after Electric Guitars.
data.text:
The GIBSON 1956 Les Paul GoldTop VOS has just arrived at our Melbourne CBD store, so we take a deep dive into everything that makes the Goldtop one of the most sought-after Electric Guitars.

The Gibson 1956 Les Paul GoldTop VOS (Vintage Original Spec) is not just a guitar; it's a piece of history. Highly esteemed among guitar enthusiasts and collectors, the story behind this iconic instrument is deeply rooted in Gibson's history and the evolution of the Les Paul series.

Origins of the Les Paul GoldTop

The Les Paul Model Introduction (1952):

The Gibson Les Paul was first introduced in 1952, named after the famous guitarist and inventor Les Paul. The initial design featured a gold-painted top, giving it the name "GoldTop." This finish was chosen for its luxurious appearance.

Evolution to the 1956 Model:

By 1956, the Les Paul GoldTop had undergone several refinements. Notable changes included the introduction of the Tune-o-Matic bridge, which allowed for more precise intonation adjustments. This bridge replaced the earlier trapeze tailpiece, significantly improving the instrument's playability and tuning stability.

Key Features of the 1956 Les Paul GoldTop

P-90 Pickups:

The 1956 GoldTop featured two P-90 single-coil pickups. These pickups were known for their bright, articulate sound, which was well-suited for the rock and roll music of the era.

Mahogany Body and Maple Cap:

The guitar's construction included a solid mahogany body with a carved maple cap. This combination of woods provided a rich, resonant tone with a balance of warmth and brightness.

Vintage Appointments:

The 1956 model retained many of the vintage appointments that made the Les Paul iconic, such as the bound body and neck, trapezoid inlays, and gold top finish.

The VOS (Vintage Original Spec) Reissue

The Gibson Custom Shop introduced the VOS series to recreate the look, feel, and sound of vintage instruments. The 1956 Les Paul GoldTop VOS is a meticulous reproduction of the original 1956 model, with attention to detail in both construction and aesthetics.

Aging and Finish:

The VOS models are known for their lightly aged finishes, replicating the wear and patina of a vintage guitar. The gold top is treated to achieve a slightly dulled and authentic appearance.

Hardware and Components:

The VOS reissues use period-correct hardware and components, including vintage-style tuners, historically accurate plastics, and wiring.

Craftsmanship:

These guitars are handcrafted by Gibsonâ€™s Custom Shop luthiers, ensuring high standards of quality and authenticity. The neck profiles, fretwork, and overall construction adhere closely to the original specifications.

Cultural and Musical Impact

Like other Les Paul models, the 1956 Les Paul GoldTop has been favoured by countless legendary guitarists. Its distinctive tone and playability have made it a staple in various music genres, from blues and jazz to rock and roll. The VOS reissue allows modern players to experience the charm and character of a classic instrument, preserving the legacy of one of the most influential electric guitars in history.

While a comprehensive list of every guitarist who has used the Gibson 1956 Les Paul GoldTop is challenging to compile due to the sheer number of musicians and the passage of time, here are some notable guitarists known for their use of this iconic instrument:

Blues and Rock Legends

Duane Allman - Pioneering slide guitarist and member of the Allman Brothers Band.

Freddie King - Influential blues guitarist known for his powerful playing style.

Mike Bloomfield - Renowned blues guitarist associated with the Paul Butterfield Blues Band and Electric Flag.

Keith Richards - Rolling Stones guitarist known for his raw, blues-influenced style.

Les Paul - The guitar's namesake, innovator, and influential musician.

Steve Hackett - Genesis guitarist known for his progressive rock influence.

Joe Bonamassa - Modern blues-rock guitarist who has used and collected many vintage Les Pauls.

These musicians, among others, have utilised the Gibson 1956 Les Paul GoldTop for its unique tone, playability, and aesthetic appeal. Their contributions across various genres have solidified the guitar's legendary status in the music world.

So feel free to come in to Colemans Music at our Melbourne CBD store, 105 Elizabeth St Melbourne or call 03 96545115. You ca also Shop online for the best price on a 1956 Gibson Les Paul GoldTop VOS.
